ai.summary: A scenic 14 km coastal hike in the UK toward Hoswick. This moderate route follows rugged shoreline, sea cliffs, and tidal beaches, offering expansive coastal views and a chance to spot seabirds along the way.
ai.terrain_summary: Coastal terrain with uneven paths, rocky sections, grassy tracks near the shore, and occasional boards or fords. Expect slippery rocks near the tide, wind-exposed stretches, and mud in wet conditions.
ai.safety_notes: Check tide times and weather before you start. Some stretches run close to the water and ground can be unstable near cliffs. Wear sturdy boots, layer clothing, and carry a map or GPS. Bring extra water and snacks, plus a whistle and a charged phone for emergencies. Tell someone your route and expected return time.
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn for milder weather and clearer views; summer provides longer daylight, while autumn offers quieter trails and dramatic lighting.

seo.title: Coastal Route to Hoswick — 14 km Moderate Coastal Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover a 14 km coastal hike to Hoswick in the UK. A moderate route along rugged shores, sea cliffs, and tidal beaches with tips on safety and gear.
